Dialogue.Page: Sigh... Yeah, guys, no need to worry about me. I love sitting up here all on my own.
<size=20>Yeah, no need to come visit! It's not like I need any social interaction or anything like that.</size>
<size=20><color=grey>Sigh...</color></size>
Huh? Hello?
Is someone there?
Ah, hello...astronaut?<Pause> But wait a minute...you're way too small. Which means...
Which means that you're in big trouble, little hatchling!
You stole a spaceship?! I'm going to radio down to Hornfels and tell them what you did!
Oh yeah? And why shouldn't I?

DialogueOption.Text: I'll bring you sap wine if you promise not to tell them!
I'll hang out with you if you promise not to tell them!
I'll run away into space if you tell them!
They'll never let me be an astronaut if you tell them!
You're a loser if you tell them!

Dialogue.Page: Sap wine? I can't stand the stuff.
You're gonna have to do better than that. <size=20>Lemme just get out my radio here...</size>
Hey, Hornfels? Yeah, you're never gonna believe this.
Ha, hang out? Why in the world would I want to hang out with a...
Well, I mean...really, it's pretty ridiculous to think...uh...
Hm. You see...
Alright, you know what? Sure. You've got yourself a deal.
Good luck with that. When I tell Hornfels that you're up here, he's sure to...well, you'll see!
Ha. Run away. That's a good one. Hehe! <size=20>Lemme just get out my radio here...</size>
Hey, Hornfels? Yeah, you're never gonna believe this.
After this stunt? Probaby not!
<size=20>Lemme just get out my radio here...</size>
Hey, Hornfels? Yeah, you're never gonna believe this.
Hah. A loser? Yeah, that sure stings. Oooooh, how will I ever recover? I just got called a loser by an infant! Oh, boo, hoo, hoo-
<size=50>HA HA HA HA HA </size>ho ho! That's a good one. <size=20>Lemme just get out my radio here...</size>
Hey, Hornfels? Yeah, you're never gonna believe this. You're never gonna believe what they called me either! Hehe!
It has been a while since anyone stopped by.

Dialogue.Page: Hey, hold on a second! You're not keeping up your end of the bargain!
<size=20>Well then...No deal. Lemme just get out my radio here...</size>
Hey, Hornfels? Yeah, you're never gonna believe this.
Don’t go! Uh, I mean, anything else you wanted to ask?

DialogueOption.Text: Don’t the other travelers come by?

Dialogue.Page: The Lunar Outpost saw more traffic back when our ships were less sophisticated and needed more frequent repairs. Nowadays, it’s mostly used to keep a set of eyes on things.
Sometimes Chert comes by to say hi, but Gabbro is Gabbro, and you know how Riebeck feels about “unnecessary spaceflight.”
A little. I’m in touch with ground control – Hornfels and Gossan, mostly – and they radio up to chat now and then.
And when ground control forgets I’m up here <size=20>and they usually do</size>, I launch my Little Scout at the village.
I don’t blame them. For one, I don’t check in as often as the other travelers, since I’m always in one place.
And it’s not so bad up here, really. At least it’s peaceful and quiet. You don’t always get that in our solar system.
Let alone in our village.
What? No! It’s not spying, it’s...
It’s one-way communication. That none of the villagers know about. <size=20>Because I’ve never told them</size>.
Probably. Or actually, definitely. The other travelers carry instruments, so they don’t bother whistling.
You can pick up their music with a signalscope <size=20>if you even know what that is</size>. Best spot for that is the <color=orange>north pole</color>. Great reception.

The north pole is marked in red on your <color=orange>mini map</color>, but the Attlerock is a pretty small moon, really. Although you're pretty small yourself, so I guess it must seem pretty big to you.
What, they haven't taught you that in pee-wee school yet?
Welcome to the Lunar Outpost, which apparently the space program doesn’t bother to teach anyone anymore.

When we first started Outer Wilds, travelers used to bring their ships here all the time for repairs. Our spacefaring technology has improved loads since then, but the older ships tended to, uh, fall apart a lot. Like, more than they do now.

Using the outpost cut down on the number of launches and landings taking place in the village and also the number of fires. Nowadays, though, it’s mostly just me up here raising saplings from Timber Hearth and keeping an eye on things.
Heh, Marl is probably the only one who remembers I’m up here. I should go see the big lug soon.
Don’t tell them about this, but sometimes I throw my Little Scout down to make sure Marl isn’t doing anything stupid. I worry that big tree in the village wouldn’t stand a chance otherwise.
A deal's a deal. I'll keep quiet about you being up here.
Hornfels is positively livid. You're gonna be in for a rough ride when Gossan comes and brings you back.
